subject: AW: [junit] JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4: Using RetroWeaver ?
msgSnippet: Hi all, to open a different discussion stream about JUnit 4.x and JDK 1.4: During writing an article about JUnit 4, I spent some time looking into RetroWeaver
messageBody:
Hi all,

to open a different discussion stream about JUnit 4.x and JDK 1.4:

During writing an article about JUnit 4, I spent some time looking into
RetroWeaver (http://retroweaver.sourceforge.net/) and JDK backward
compatibility. Annotations have been supported by RetroWeaver, but access
via reflection has been missing (which is frequently used by JUnit). See
also http://sourceforge.net/forum/message.php?msg_id=3405558

I just found, that RetroWeaver has published one week before (Sept. 04th) a
new release 2.0 beta, with annotation support. I will have a look inside,
and restart my previous tests again. I will give an update to mailing list.

Bye, Jochen

See also http://www.junitext.org
Some slides at http://www.java-forum-stuttgart.de/folien/D5_Hiller.pdf
(german only)



-----Ursprüngliche Nachricht-----
Von: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]Im Auftrag von
Cédric Beust ?
Gesendet: Mittwoch, 13. September 2006 20:35
An: junit@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4


On 9/13/06, Vishal Vishnoi <vvishnoi@...> wrote:
>
> I would also like jdk 1.4 support for Junt4.x. If TestNG could do it, I
> don't see why JUnit team should not do it. Simply follow what TestNG has
> done -> http://testng.org/doc/documentation-main.html#jdk-14.

Indeed, it's very simple (and even fun) to implement: bunch of factories,
you abstract your annotations behind interfaces, and you're good to go. I
thought that fans of design patterns and object-oriented programming would
go nuts with such a fun problem :-)

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
